thread.title: Archie Thompson signs new one-year deal with Melbourne Victory | The
thread.title_full: Archie Thompson signs new one-year deal with Melbourne Victory | The Advertiser

author: Matt Windley
title: Archie Thompson signs new one-year deal with Melbourne Victory | The
text:
HE’S staying.
Archie Thompson will continue his illustrious Melbourne Victory career in to an 11th season after agreeing to a new one-year deal on Thursday.
The A-League’s all-time leading goalscorer had come out of contract after helping the club to a third title in May and received interest from both here and abroad.
But he put pen to paper after meeting with coach Kevin Muscat at AAMI Park this morning, ending speculation the striker may end his association with the club.
Thompson, 36, has played 210 games for Victory, scoring 89 goals.
Last season, however, he was reduced to more of an impact player, coming off the bench in 10 of his 26 appearances, although he still managed to score 11 goals including one in the 3-0 semi-final win over Melbourne City.
The 54-time Socceroo will report to AAMI Park for the start of Victory’s pre-season campaign on Monday.
And while Victory is set to receive salary cap relief in the form of the mooted long-term loyalty payment scheme — which will allow the club to pay as much as 50 per cent of Thompson’s wage outside the salary cap — Victory was able to come to an arrangement with Thompson even though the new Collective Bargaining Agreement hasn’t been bedded down by Football Federation Australia, the clubs and the players’ association.
Melbourne Victory chief executive Ian Robson said Thompson’s signature was key.
“Kevin Muscat said all along that he wanted Archie to stay at the club,” Robson said.
“With the Collective Bargaining Agreement negotiations between FFA and PFA stalling, we moved to reach a position with Archie that enables him to stay and commence pre-season training as a contracted player on Monday.
“We are all thrilled to have Archie wear the Melbourne Victory strip for an incredible 11th consecutive season and for him to play his part in contributing to our title defence.”
Originally published as Archie signs on with Victory
